sentences.sentence: The UK's former Prime Minister Boris Johnson deliberately misled lawmakers and would have been banned from Parliament's lower house if he hadn't resigned last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A scathing report from the House of Commons Privileges Committee found Johnson had lied about holding parties during the pandemic lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: He stood down as an MP on Friday ahead of the publication of the damning report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: report. It's the culmination of a year-long investigation into Johnson's conduct during the pandemic, which also found he was complicit in the campaign of abuse and attempted intimidation of the committee. It's the latest episode in the so-called Partygate scandal, which revealed members of Johnson's staff held a series of parties in 2020 and 2021 when such gatherings were prohibited by pandemic restrictions. Johnson dismissed the committee as a kangaroo court, which hadn't looked at the facts.

sentences.sentence: The European Central Bank has raised interest rates by a quarter of a percent as inflation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the eighth straight increase since July last year as the central bank struggles to contain surging consumer costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Inflation has fallen in sub-sectors, with the ECB is not ruling out further interest hikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Our future decisions will ensure that the key ECB interest rates will be brought to levels sufficiently restrictive to achieve a timely return of inflation to our 2% medium-term target and will be kept at those levels for as long as necessary.
